text:
5˚You know what kind of men we proved to be
                                among you
                                for your sake.
6˚And you became imitators of us
                       and of the Lord,
    for you received the word in much affliction,
            with the joy of the Holy Spirit,
    7˚so that you became an example
                            to all the believers
                                       in Macedonia
                                   and in Achaia.
8˚For
    not only has the word of the Lord sounded forth
                                      from you
                                      in Macedonia
                                      and Achaia,
    but your faith in God
             has gone forth everywhere,
                 so that we need not say anything.
      9˚For they themselves report concerning us
          the kind of reception we had among you,
          and how you turned to God from idols
          to serve the living and true God,
       10˚and to wait for his Son from heaven,
            whom he raised from the dead,
            Jesus who delivers us
                      from the wrath to come.

God: gives word that goes to various peoples from believers
is able to be turned to
is able to be served by us
the Son will come from heaven
the Son was raised from the dead
Jesus delivers us from the wrath to come
Authors: were worthy men among the Thessalonians
experienced the joy of the Holy Spirit
did not feel a need to defend the Thessalonian's faith
heard the Macedonian and Achaian report of the Thessalonian's faith
were received well by the Thessalonians
will be delivered by Jesus from the wrath to come
Thessalonians: had joy in the Holy Spirit
were an example to all the believers in Macedonia and in Achaia
the word of the Lord sounded forth from them
their faith in God went forth everywhere
received Paul, Silvanus and Timothy well
were waiting for Jesus from heaven
will be delivered by Jesus from the wrath to come

keywords.imitators: the merit and praise of the Thessalonians was that they were good disciples, the trajectory of their lives was toward God and toward the apostles example
keywords.example: Paul heavily emphasizes the work of the Spirit in the Thessalonians, the work that was so evident that their faith was well known, even to the surrounding regions
keywords.turned: this is significant, the Thessalonians did not turn from some aimless wandering, some lazy agnosticism or indeterminate naturalism; they turned away from worship of a false god, and toward worshipping the true God and to serve Him
keywords.true: the true God, the one and only, no other will do

points: The Thessalonians received Jesus with affliction and joy
The Thessalonians faith was an example to the surrounding regions
The Thessalonians turned from idols to God
Jesus was raised from the dead, will come from heaven and deliver us from the wrath to come
titles: No suffering, no idol will keep me from God
We believe, we wait, we will be delivered

emotions.gratefulness: Paul was very grateful for the Thessalonians, there example and the work of God evidenced in their faith

unwisdom.saying: How to be successful, 5 easy steps inside
unwisdom.comment: How to be afflicted and turn away from everything that used to important to you: the vastly superior worth of knowing Christ: please read the Gospels for further detail.

unwisdom.saying: Uncage the bird! Spread your beautiful wings and show your true color! Your song is the only song that ought matter to you now! You are a soaring angel if angels there ever were!
unwisdom.comment: Uncage the lion and gobble up that pesky bird! The Thessalonians were not known purely for their own renown, but for the renown of God shining through them. God is my song and my salvation, I am not my own song! God's wings are a shelter over me, He is my strength and my shield! Not to me, but to You, Oh God, be the glory!

conversation.question: Look again at verses 9 and 10. Notice that it wasn’t simply their faith in some God that the Thessalonians were known for￼, but their faith in the resurrection, return and deliverance of Jesus that the church was known for. Is this how￼ you are known by others? Why or why not? What would it look like or what would need to happen for this to be true of you?
